body_html:
You mean because people want to e.g. use their own specific user with a password or use a completely different database name @carpodaster? I honestly did not think about this use case 🙈.
I expected this not to be a common thing to do... Or at least I'd expect the people who do this to also be used to taking the necessary actions to not accidentally commit this file..

Do you see the problem for newcomers to Rails / the project or for anyone?

A tiny disadvantage I see with not having the file under source control would be not being able to set things like the pool size. Heroku also has a blog post on the topic of database.yml files where they mention this.

body:
You mean because people want to e.g. use their own specific user with a password or use a completely different database name @carpodaster? I honestly did not think about this use case 🙈.
I expected this not to be a common thing to do... Or at least I'd expect the people who do this to also be used to taking the necessary actions to not accidentally commit this file..

Do you see the problem for newcomers to Rails / the project or for anyone?

A tiny disadvantage I see with not having the file under source control would be not being able to set things like the pool size. Heroku also has a [blog post](https://devcenter.heroku.com/changelog-items/709) on the topic of `database.yml` files where they mention this.
